channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Putin Glosses Over Russian Setbacks, Including Syria
item.description: The Russian president, in a marathon annual news conference, said that he had not yet met with Bashar al-Assad, the ousted Syrian leader who fled to M...

item.title: Bias in medical algorithms is one of AI’s long-running issues. Will new guidelines ignite action?
item.description: An international coalition suggests steps to tackle bias in medical AI, but the impact remains unclear

item.title: Gisèle Pelicot’s Testimony in France Rape Trial Becomes a Message of Hope
item.description: Dozens of men who abused Gisèle Pelicot were convicted, including the man who invited them to do so: her husband of 50 years. She wanted the public tr...

item.title: A new app lets you see your future neighbors’ political affiliation before you buy a house
item.description: Odyssey helps people who are looking for a debate—or trying to avoid one.

item.title: Elon Musk Flexes His Political Strength as Government Shutdown Looms
item.description: The world’s richest man led the charge to kill a bipartisan spending deal, in part by promoting false and misleading claims about it.

item.title: Why Kylie Kelce’s Podcast, ‘Not Gonna Lie,’ Is a Breakout Hit
item.description: But in her first interview since her podcast reached No. 1, she does share ideas about why the show has become a breakout hit.

item.title: Five great last-minute gift ideas this holiday season
item.description: Put off shopping for too long? Don’t worry, there’s still hope.

item.title: LinkedIn COO tells workers to be prepared for this AI question in job interviews in 2025
item.description: Workers need to be ready to talk about how they use AI in their personal and professional life.

item.title: Maps: See Israel’s Moves in Syria Since al-Assad Was Toppled

item.title: Trump’s Return May Worsen Financial Woes for Global Health Institutions
item.description: The U.S. provides nearly half of the aid for global health, including childhood vaccination, H.I.V. treatment and disease surveillance.

item.title: Trump Tossed a Debt Limit Grenade Into Spending Talks. Here’s Why.
item.description: President-elect Donald J. Trump was forced to negotiate with Democrats over the borrowing cap during his first term.

item.title: Why It’s a Mistake to Charge Luigi Mangione With Terrorism
item.description: It could complicate a simple case and turn it into a political circus.

item.title: Giséle Pelicot’s Ex-Husband Found Guilty in Mass Rape Trial
